intro: Galium cruciata var. laevipes, commonly known as the smooth bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically opposite and elliptic in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The smooth, hairless stems and leaves contribute to its common name.
